Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. We productionalize these ML models as microservices and build data pipelines necessary for inference and model training.
Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day. 
We're looking for an experienced senior software engineer to join our highly impactful team to help us build and extend our Predictive Search Service. A Software Engineer will be responsible for high quality implementation and consistent maintenance of systems that support auto-complete search behavior on Wayfair's sites. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.
What you will do:

Work with a broader highly collaborative cross-functional team that includes product managers, data scientists, and analysts.
Work with a variety of technologies, including Java, Spark, Kafka, Aerospike, Hadoop, Airflow, RESTful web services, gRPC, Kubernetes. Additionally, youll work with various managed GCP offerings like BigQuery, Composer and Vertex AI.
Build platforms and services that allow us to make realtime ML powered decisions that improve the customers onsite search experience.
Deliver direct measurable results for our business and customers through improved product recommendations.
Mentor junior engineers to develop the next generation of Wayfair engineering.
Provide high quality code and technical design reviews.
Contribute to the code base, with a mind to best practices and an equally high degree of autonomy.

What you will need

A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related engineering discipline.
2+ years of experience in a modern programming language, preferably Java 
Knowledge of scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of object oriented design and design patterns.
Knowledge of designing APIs and microservices.
Experience working on cloud technologies specifically GCP is a plus.
Experience with Lucene-based Search engines like Elasticsearch is a plus.
Knowledge of recommendation systems and productionalizing ML models is a plus.
Experience using Kubernetes, Docker, Buildkite, and Terraform for containerization and CI/CD is a plus.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.

Title: Software Engineering Manager, App Aquire & Activate
RoleDescription:
Engineering Manager - App Acquire & Activate (Toronto TDC)
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Toronto, Canada and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Partnering with Product, Experience Design, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair, our Native App Engineering teams contribute to an award-winning mobile experience that makes shopping for your home delightful and engaging. iOS and Android engineers leverage the full capabilities of mobile devices and their SDKs. For example, our apps take advantage of augmented reality, computer vision-assisted product search using the devices camera, and machine learning to create personalized experiences and improve the speed of the app.
 
The App Acquire & Activate team charter is to facilitate smooth onboarding of customers and continuous engagement and retention during our customers shopping and home project lifecycle by creating new value propositions for the Wayfair App Experience designed to serve the needs of early lifecycle and low-purchase intent users. The ideal candidate has experience in native app development (iOS or Android), and a proven track record of managing stakeholders and external partners. Experience or general interest in modern native application development techniques, Artificial Intelligence and GraphQL is a big plus!  This person will leverage their breadth of knowledge in these areas to lead and grow a multi-disciplinary engineering team that delivers features for Wayfair shoppers to make their shopping experience frictionless and delightful.
 
What You'll Do

Lead a team of iOS and Android developers working on features and tech that powers our native apps shopping experience.
Promote, coach, and drive a high quality culture into the team and organization
Proactively manage critical project issues, risks and challenges, utilizing project management tools and business expertise to deliver projects.
Lead and drive engineering initiatives from inception to development, and deployment. Initiatives may cut across multiple aspects of the applications.
Work closely with product management and business stakeholders to understand and translate business objectives into technical solutions.
Represent the engineering team in cross-functional projects and to the company at large.
Utilize strong leadership skills to build the best high performing team.
Coach, mentor, and keep 1:1 with team members as well as gather feedback and implement necessary improvements.
Ensure high quality and performance standards for the Wayfair mobile platform.
Oversee the definition of best practices and coding standards across the entire team; review code and provide guidance for other code reviewers participating in our release approval process.  
Use data and metrics to collaboratively drive impactful changes across the application; work closely with product and engineering management to anticipate areas for improvement and investment, and highlight these for inclusion in the team's project roadmap.

What You'll Bring

At least 3+ years of engineering leadership or management experience
At least 7+ years of software development experience with ideally 3+ years of native app development (iOS or Android)
Experience in either Swift or Kotlin in building mobile applications with a desire to continuously learn as you strive to develop and improve your team.
Knowledge of mobile software design patterns and experience working with a variety of architectures.
Experience recruiting, managing, fostering and retaining talent on a technical team.
Agile experience and extensive experience working on an agile development team.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
High level of accountability, bias to action and a desire to empower individuals on the team to perform at their best.
Focus on team building and collaboration over individual performance.

 
How will you be challenged?
As an engineering manager you will be a technical leader working hand in hand with your product counterpart in setting the direction for one of the most impactful development teams in the Wayfair app development organization.  As we continue to grow, we have been tackling challenges of launching and supporting multiple apps, modularizing our code, and achieving feature parity across Android, iOS, web, and mobile web.  We seek managers who are comfortable leading these efforts and building on the existing foundation of our award winning Wayfair app.

Title: Recruiter, Wayfair Stores
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $60800-$69,588 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
The role will be based out of our new Wayfair store in Atlanta, GA and will be onsite Monday through Friday. This role requires some flexibility to work occasional weekends or in-store events.
At Wayfair, we believe great people build great teams, and that starts with you. As our Recruiter you'll be the primary engine behind our store's talent strategy, ensuring were hiring the right people, at the right time, for the right roles. Youll build strong partnerships with store leaders, understand the unique needs of each department, and deliver a candidate experience that reflects our brand: welcoming, helpful, and a little playful.
This role is equal parts relationship-builder, problem-solver, and brand ambassador. Youll manage everything from traditional and creative sourcing, to screening candidates and offer letters, to candidate onboarding details and process changes. All of this, while constantly staying two steps ahead of the hiring curve. If you thrive in fast-paced and changing environments, love connecting people to purpose, and take pride in creating seamless hiring experiences, this role could be your professional home.What Youll Do:

 Own Onsite Recruitment: You will primarily serve as the face of Talent Acquisition in the store, working onsite five days a week to build strong, in-person relationships with stakeholders, hiring managers, and future team members.
 Understand the Business Inside & Out: Develop a deep understanding of each hiring manager and department, including Logistics, Visual, Sales, Design, Operations, and Asset Protection, to deliver qualified talent aligning with both role requirements and team culture.
 Source Strategically & Creatively: Leverage tools like Avature, GEM, Visier, and Greenhouse along with creative, boots-on-the-ground sourcing efforts. You will use this to build strong pipelines, generate quality applicant flow, and attract talent in both expected and unexpected places.
 Own Job Postings and ATS Accuracy: Create, update, and maintain job postings with precision while ensuring the applicant tracking system remains accurate, organized, and optimized for hiring success.
 Deliver Exceptional Hiring Experiences: Champion clean, consistent, and positive candidate and hiring experiences that reflect Wayfairs values from start to finish.

 Adapt and Iterate: Embrace feedback, adjust to change, and continuously improve the hiring process by solving challenges and bringing forward fresh ideas.

 Stakeholder Relations: You build trust quickly and can partner confidently with hiring managers across departments to deeply understand who and what they need on their teams.

 Recruiting Experience: You have 1+ years of experience in a high-volume corporate or agency recruiting environment and are eager to continue growing your TA expertise.
 Detail Discipline: You are highly organized while moving fast, keep systems clean, follow through flawlessly, and know how to juggle shifting priorities with ease while remaining in accordance with deadlines in a high-volume environment.
 Clear and Confident Communication: You communicate with clarity and professionalism across varying audiences that may require different approaches or messaging.
 Growth-Ready Mindset: Youre adaptable, take feedback in stride, and bring a proactive, can-do attitude to change and new challenges.
 In-Person Energy: This is a fully on-site role, and you shine in face-to-face environments where building in-person relationships makes a lasting impact.
 Talent-Spotting Everywhere: You believe great talent is all around us and treat every interaction as a potential recruiting opportunity, whether its during a shift, a store visit, or out in the community.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Customer Data Platforms
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bengaluru, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not frustration. Our Product team plays a crucial role in delivering on this vision by developing best-in-class platforms and systems that enable personalized, scalable, and impactful customer experiences across our global business.
The Customer Identity & Understanding team is building the foundational systems that power Wayfairs personalization and targeting capabilities. Our mission is to deeply understand who our customers are, even before they log in, and make that intelligence actionable across the company. We develop the core Customer Data Platform (CDP), including identity resolution, cross-device and cross-session stitching, feature engineering pipelines for machine learning, and geo-based inference engines to personalize for every customer, including in cold-start scenarios.
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager who thrives at the intersection of data platforms, machine learning, and customer-centric strategy. Youll define the product roadmap for customer data collection and activation, balancing long-term architectural bets with high-impact applications that power recommendations, marketing, and broader shopping experiences. Youll work closely with Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and teams across Wayfair to unlock scalable, privacy-aware insights about our customers.
You are a technical systems thinker with a strong product sense, excellent communication skills, and the ability to translate messy customer signals into clean, high-signal data products.
What Youll Do

Define and execute the roadmap for Customer Identity & Understanding, including:

Our deterministic and probabilistic identity graph, enabling persistent recognition of customers across devices, browsers, and sessions
The customer feature platform, powering personalization and ML model features across surfaces (Search, Recommendations, Marketing, etc.)
Enrichment pipelines for geo-based personalization, cold-start user inference, and audience understanding

Partner with engineering to make architectural tradeoffs that balance long-term scalability, data quality, and time-to-impact
Drive alignment across partner teams on data definitions, customer segmentation needs, and attribution approaches
Collaborate with legal, privacy, and security teams to ensure all identity solutions are built with privacy-by-design principles
Evangelize customer intelligence as a strategic differentiator for the business, tying your roadmap to downstream metrics (CTR, CVR, AOV, LTV)
Translate stakeholder needs into well-scoped platform enhancements that are modular, reusable, and performance-aware
Establish and track KPIs for data completeness, freshness, uniqueness, and downstream business usage

What youll Need

7+ years of product management experience, ideally building data or ML platforms or leading identity resolution or CDP-type initiatives
Strong technical acumen: you can converse comfortably with engineers about architecture, data pipelines, APIs, and event tracking
Demonstrated experience designing and shipping products that unlock ML feature engineering or personalization capabilities at scale

Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Customer Tech Data Science team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior on the website and mobile application as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.
At their core, the Customer Tech Data Science team at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business and applying advanced modeling techniques. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance.
What Youll Do:
As a Data Scientist, youll play a critical role in uncovering insights that shape strategic decisions and improve business performance. You will explore data trends, diagnose gaps, and identify growth & innovation opportunities across Wayfairs data. Your work will directly impact how the company understands performance and makes data-informed decisions.

Conduct in-depth analysis across large-scale datasets (clickstream, sales, product, logistics, and customer data) to uncover trends, gaps, and business opportunities.
Champion the use of emerging technologies - including GenAI and LLMs - to transform how we explore data and uncover insights, unlocking new ways to accelerate analysis, automate complex workflows, and make insights more accessible and actionable across the business.
Become a subject matter expert on key business metrics and customer behavior, ensuring accurate interpretation and analysis.
Drive innovation in business analysis by adopting and implementing new methodologies (e.g., key driver analysis, anomaly detection, forecasting, cohorting).
Establish robust KPI tracking and anomaly detection systems to ensure early identification of emerging issues and opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional partnersincluding Business Strategy, Product, and Engineeringto uncover actionable insights that drive growth and improve customer experience.
Design, run, and interpret A/B tests to make high-impact changes to the customer experience.
Build, automate, and maintain scalable dashboards and reports using tools like Looker, BigQuery (GBQ), SQL and Python to enable efficient and self-serve data access for stakeholders.
Develop optimized and maintainable code pipelines to transform multi-terabyte data into meaningful business insights and recommendations.

What You'll Need:

Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
2 - 4 years of work experience in a relevant field, such as analytics or data science.
Proficient knowledge of a statistical programming language such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Experience conducting quantitative analyses on large and complex data sets.
Experience in leveraging modeling algorithms to derive business insights.
Experience with experimental test design such as A/B testing.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI); experience with Looker a plus.
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems.
Strong written and verbal communication.
Ecommerce or retail analytics experience is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist II, Supply Chain Retail Technology
RoleDescription:

This is a hybrid-onsite role. Employees are expected to be in our Boston, MA office Tuesdays-Thursday, and work remotely Mondays and Fridays. 
 
Who We Are
The Supply Chain Retail Technology Data Science team is dedicated to understanding and optimizing user interactions with our Supply Chain & Retail Technology suite of tools and products. SCRT Data Science is responsible for integrating analytics into the DNA of these growing tech teams, unlocking the insights that will guide the business in our quest for cost-efficient, perfect orders, at scale, with AI and data science techniques playing a crucial role in processing vast datasets and predicting optimal outcomes. We bring a multidisciplinary blend of analytical aptitude, technical expertise, business strategy, and stakeholder management. Moreover, we're a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
 
What You'll Do

Own the insights that inform the SCRT product roadmap, including driving outcomes within Fulfillment, Transportation and Service Technology.

Collaborate with all facets of the organization including product management, engineering, and creative design to identify the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making.

Proficient knowledge of SQL and statistical programming language(s) such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS (Python preferred)

Experience with experimental test design (e.g., A/B testing; Multivariate and Multi-Armed Bandit) and statistical analysis to drive business decision making.

Experience applying data science techniques and partnering with business teams on agile model development.
Strong written and verbal communication skills covering objectives, status, results, and recommendations.
Bachelors in computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics, Operations Research, Industrial engineering or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
3+ years work experience in relevant field

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. We productionalize these ML models as microservices and build data pipelines necessary for inference and model training.
Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day. 
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our highly impactful team to help us build and extend our Storefront team. A Software Engineer will be responsible for high quality implementation and consistent maintenance of systems that support auto-complete search behavior on Wayfair's sites. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.
Work cross-functionally with different roles and your team, such as product management, core areas of the business to understand the problems we need to solve, and solution against them in a globally distributed environment.
What You'll Do:

Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and backend engineers to understand business problems and translate them into responsive and performant front-end solutions.
Build scalable, maintainable, and highly interactive user interfaces using ReactJS, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
Work with RESTful APIs and ensure seamless data integration with backend services.
Use version control tools like Git for collaborative development and efficient release cycles.
Create and optimize cross-browser and cross-platform compatible applications.
Participate in writing unit tests and maintaining test coverage using tools like Jest or React Testing Library.
Contribute to full-stack development as needed using Java (Spring Boot) and SQL, particularly for understanding and integrating front-end components with backend services.
Collaborate in Agile teams and contribute to sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous improvement practices.
Utilize CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, Docker, or Kubernetes to ensure reliable delivery of front-end applications.
Document technical solutions and maintain up-to-date knowledge of front-end best practices.

What You'll Need:

24 years of professional experience in front-end development using ReactJS and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS3, TypeScript, and responsive design principles.
Familiarity with backend technologies such as Java (Spring Boot) and experience writing or debugging SQL queries.
Experience integrating front-end components with REST APIs or GraphQL services.
Solid understanding of front-end state management patterns (e.g., Redux, Context API).
Basic understanding of containerised deployment environments such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
Knowledge of modern development tools and build systems (Webpack, Babel, NPM/Yarn).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work across teams.
Good documentation skills for writing and maintaining technical specifications and project artifacts.

Nice to Have:

Familiarity with monitoring/logging tools like Elasticsearch, Grafana, or Prometheus.
Understanding of messaging systems like Kafka or Redis.

RoleDescription:
Logistics & Inventory Operations, Specialist
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
The entry rate for this role is $20/hr. 
Overview:As a Logistics & Inventory Operations Specialist, youll play a vital role in keeping Wayfairs Physical Retail operations running smoothly as we redefine the customer shopping experience. Your work, from managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, directly supports an exceptional, seamless experience for our customers. 
With a sharp eye for detail and a proactive problem-solving mindset, youll focus on inventory accuracy, exception management, and operational efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, partners effectively across teams, and takes ownership in building a flawless operational foundation that reflects Wayfairs commitment to retail excellence and a top-tier customer experience.
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Specialist Do?

 Demonstrates Reliability: Be present and punctual for every shift to ensure were ready to support customers when it matters most. Communicate proactively about any unexpected events or issues.
 Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Conduct daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to protect inventory integrity. Use scanning technology to track carton-level details such as condition, quantity, and location.

 Support Operational Excellence: Use ticketing systems to manage exceptions and resolve issues. Provide feedback on tools and processes to improve efficiency based on your frontline experience.

 Adapt and Problem-Solve: Own inventory challenges, drive solutions, and ensure smooth coordination between warehouse and retail teams in a fast-moving environment.

 Customer Service Skills: Strong communication skills and ability to stay calm and professional under pressure.
 Adaptability and Problem-Solving: Comfortable with evolving tools, systems, and processes, and able to take initiative to maintain operational excellence.

Title: Safety & Security Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $65,340.00-$71,775  per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Wayfair Security and SupervisorLocation: Port Wentworth, GA
Safety & Security Supervisor
Overview
The Wayfair Global Safety and Security (GLOSS) team is a multifunctional team that prioritizes mitigating risk by protecting our assets, intelligence collection, collaborative process improvements, and continuously evolving our culture through an inclusive approach to health and safety. We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because we are driven, determined and relentless about taking care of our people in a fast-paced environment. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company.
The Safety and Security Site Supervisor will be responsible for providing leadership on all life safety and security related standards, systems, processes, while driving our safety and security initiatives across the supply chain network. This role reports to the Supply Chain Safety and Security Manager and will be responsible for providing leadership with options, recommendations, and best practices as a subject matter expert in safety and security.
 
What Youll Do


Partner with operations to ensure the implementation and adherence of all aspects of our Injury and Illness Prevention Plan for assigned location(s).


Partner with the Global Safety and Security Business Support and Compliance Teams to support operations in executing Global Safety and Security initiatives.


Escalate requested changes and best practices to the Safety Compliance Team for review and standardization.


Anticipate, identify, evaluate hazardous conditions and build practices to aid in all critical incident planning, preparation, and responses.


Conduct inspections of facilities to identify and correct potential hazards, security risks, and ensure regulatory compliance.


Partner cross-functionally with all levels of site management in assigned location(s) to mitigate risk and resolve safety and security related issues.


Partner with site leadership in developing action plans to improve safety/security culture in assigned location(s) and promote employee engagement in safety/security programs.


Partner with operations and key stakeholders, to ensure all new hires receive safety orientation, and verify annual training requirements for existing employees.


Assist in the implementation and execution of safety and security accountability programs.


Maintain effective working relationships with regulatory agencies, industry security and life safety professionals, vendors, and suppliers.


Prepare and submit security incident reports in compliance with company and insurance carrier requirements. Support any related investigations.


Provide daily guidance to the third-party guard service. Ensure guards are following documented post orders. Work to ensure there are no gaps in guard coverage.


Conduct physical security, camera system, and access control checks to ensure compliance.


 
What Youll Need


2+ years in a dedicated Safety/Security role or similar experience required. Bachelors Degree not required but preferred.


Lean Six-Sigma experience desired.


OSHA 10 or OSHA 30 Certification, preferred.


Demonstrated knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements that govern worker health and safety, physical assessment and ergonomic skills, and case management skills.


Knowledge of local, state, and federal fire and safety regulations and laws.


Demonstrated working knowledge of safety and security concepts, best practices, policies, programs, and procedures. Preferably in a retail distribution environment.


Ability to handle multiple projects, set priorities, strong organizational and time management skills.


Flexibility to support multiple buildings across multiple shifts that are dynamic and have changing business needs.


Excellent analytical and organizational skills, and demonstrated experience with hypothesis-driven learning and turning data into actionable insights.


Superior communication skills with the ability to navigate a complex organization and generate buy-in for ideas and plans.


Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action and ability to deal with extreme ambiguity and rapidly changing environments.


Strong reputation for honesty, integrity, and professionalism, including an ability to maintain confidentiality.


Must be able to stand and/or walk in a variety of weather and terrain conditions for shifts up to 10 hours.


Must be able to lift and hold 15 pounds.


Be able to work effectively in warehouse environments with hot and cold conditions, as well as loud noises.


Ability to travel within your assigned area of responsibility. Occasional (10%) overnight travel is required.


This is an onsite role with 40 hours that vary across multiple shifts as the needs of the business change to operational requirements.


In this role, one will drive positive change through collaboration with other management members. Working closely with operations management, this person will communicate, train, and coach safe work behaviors that align with Wayfairs safety policies and security protocols. Additionally, this person will oversee third-party security guards to ensure they meet performance standards. The primary focus will be on assessing, reducing, and eliminating risks, as well as mitigating threats to our people, company, and assets.


GLOSS serves as a support function focused on upholding and enhancing our reputation as a "great place to work" by ensuring a safe and secure work environment. The work we do directly impacts this reputation. Reducing injuries and incidents not only fosters a positive culture but also leads to substantial cost savings for our organization, as diligent efforts to prevent safety and security-related issues help avoid associated expenses.


This individual will engage with various levels of management and interact with hundreds of warehouse associates, though there will be no direct reports. This position is unique within the building, with no other similar roles. This person will report to the GLOSS Regional Field Manager and will be part of a team of 4-7 members.
